intro: Pseudobastardia tiubae f. perennis, commonly known as the perennial form of the genus Pseudobastardia, is a rare and specialized plant species. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. This plant is typically found in specific microhabitats, often in rocky or alpine environments. Its morphology includes finely divided leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to its limited distribution and unique ecological requirements, it is considered a species of conservation interest.
